Jobs.Description:
Division Chief of Cardiology

Stamford Hospital is seeking an innovative, highly visible, clinically skilled and gifted leader, for the position of Division Chief of Cardiology. This is an opportunity for a visionary and dynamic leader to craft a long term vision and execution plan for the Heart and Vascular Institute (HVI) that will reinforce cardiovascular care as a hallmark, destination service for Stamford Hospital. Active clinicians with a broad view of cardiac and vascular services, a passion for improvement of the patient experience and the skill to integrate and unify the agenda of various physician stakeholders will see this as a career defining opportunity. The new Chief of Cardiology along with the current Chief of Cardiac Surgery for Stamford Hospital will oversee all healthcare delivered under the aegis of the HVI, including integrated clinical programs and care, the ambulatory enterprise, the testing centers, research initiatives, and important integration and collaborations with other Stamford Hospital Departments and Divisions.

MD degree and appropriate Board certification(s) are required. The ideal candidate must possess demonstrable leadership skills, leadership experience as a clinical program director and/or Division Chief, with a track record of successful program-building, particularly across Departmental lines. Familiarity with the marketing of cardiovascular services would be ideal.

Candidates with a clinical interest in heart failure medicine would be especially welcome. Candidates should also have keen insights into the cardiovascular hybrid model of care.

Nominations and expressions of interest should be directed, ideally in an email format to:

Kim Smith and/or Stephen Davis at StamfordHospChiefCardiology@wittkieffer.com, 781.272.8899, or Witt/Kieffer, 25 Burlington Mall Road, Sixth Floor, Burlington, MA 01803.

Jobs.Description:
Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center

Boston, Massachusetts

Clinical Associate in Cardiac Surgery: A one-year program is available for individuals seeking additional training in cardiac surgery.

Minimum requirements include an MD degree and eligibility or Board Certification from both the American Board of Surgery and the American Board of Thoracic Surgery (highly desirable).

Foreign medical graduates must be certified by the ECFMG and also be eligible for licensure in the State of Massachusetts. The position will focus on aortic surgery and minimally invasive procedures. An opportunity for learning catheter based skills is also possible. The Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center, a 590-bed tertiary and quaternary care hospital, is a founding member of Caregroup, an organized system of quality healthcare serving individuals, families and communities in New England. Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center and Harvard Medical School are Equal Opportunity Employers. Women and minorities are particularly encouraged to apply.

Interested applicants should submit cover letter and CV to

Dr. Kamal R. Khabbaz

The CardioVascular Institute

Division of Cardiac Surgery

110 Francis Street, Suite 2A

Boston, MA 02215

Beth Israel Deaconess Medical Center and Harvard Medical School are Equal Opportunity Employers.

Women and minorities are particularly encouraged to apply.

Jobs.Description:
MEMORIALSLOAN-KETTERINGCANCERCENTER(NEW YORK,NY)

Program Director: Richard M. Steingart, MD

Cardiology Service/Clinical and Research Fellowship

The Cardiology Service at Memorial Sloan-Kettering Cancer Center is offering a one year clinical and research fellowship in cardio-oncology for individuals who are ABIM eligible/certified in Internal Medicine.  Excellent clinical experience with protected time/tutelage in research and advanced cardiac imaging including echo, CTA and MRI. 

Recruitment:

Positions available for July 2013 and July 2014 start dates.   Applicants should complete an application and submit three letters of recommendation; curriculum vitae, personal statement, and medical school diploma. Deadline for submission is June 1st.

Memorial Sloan-Kettering Cancer Center is an equal opportunity employer with a strong commitment to enhancing the diversity of its faculty and staff.  Women and applicants from diverse racial, ethnic and cultural backgrounds are encouraged to apply.

Richard M. Steingart, MD

Chief, Cardiology Service

Memorial Sloan-Kettering Cancer Center

1275 York Avenue

Box #43

New York, NY 10065

For more information, please contact

Mon Cheri Medina

Administrative Secretary

Phone: (212) 639-5154

Fax: (212) 717-3624

Jobs.Company: The University of Texas Health Science Center at Houston
Jobs.Description:
The University of Texas Health Science Center at Houston, Program of Advanced Heart Failure, has 2 CV Surgery fellowship positions available.

This fellowship provides an extensive experience in the management of patients with end stage heart failure. There is a programmatic commitment to providing trainees with a broad exposure in intra-operative decision making and the technical aspects of surgical techniques. Other responsibilities would include the pre-operative evaluation of patients admitted and post-operative care, both in the intensive care unit and the clinic. Opportunities for clinical research are also available.

Duties will include patient care responsibilities with cardiovascular surgery patients, heart, heart-lung, and lung transplant procedures and the insertion of organ procurement and mechanical circulatory support devices.

It is recognized that the majority of these cases occur outside the elective day schedule but also represent a vital component of the fellow’s educational experience. Fellows on call for LVAD/Heart TX will attend cardiac clinics to assess and manage pre-operative cardiac surgery patients, but mostly end stage heart failure patients.

During the rotation the fellow will participate in the care of postoperative cardiac surgical patients, CVICU, the fellow will benefit with the regular exposure over the course of the year. Their skill level and confidence will increase during the year. CV surgical fellows are assigned to the unit each weekday. The fellow will become proficient in the management of post op cardiac surgical patients.

The types of surgeries that are performed by the cardiothoracic surgeon in our department include bypassing blocked coronary arteries, and performing surgical treatment on conditions such as high risk cardiovascular surgery patients, heart failure patients and structural heart disease patients.

  • Determine the requirement of surgical operations, estimate risks to patients, and determine the best appropriate operating procedure.
  • Learn the medical history of the patients and anticipate the results that are expected after the surgery.
  • Decide on the procedure for operation depending on the physical condition of the patient.
  • Provide information regarding the risks associated with the surgery.
  • Manage, plan and schedule the surgery, once the physical condition of the patient is completely analyzed.
  • Prepare the patients’ case history after the successful completion of the operation.
  • Provide care to the patient after surgery.
  • Issue discharge summary to all the patients before they leave the hospital.
  • Maintain good relationship with the patients

If interested, please forward your CV to: Eva.M.Pongratz@uth.tmc.edu

Jobs.Company: Weill Cornell Medical College / NewYork Presbyterian Hospital
Jobs.Description:
FACULTY POSITION

Cardiac Anesthesiology Division  

 

The Department of Anesthesiology at Weill Cornell Medical College/NewYork Presbyterian Hospital is seeking an experienced ABA and NBE (Advanced Perioperative TEE) diplomate academic anesthesiologist to participate in the clinical and research activities of the Cardiac Anesthesiology Division.

 

The successful candidate will handle all modern era invasive and non-invasive cardiac surgical and interventional procedures. Experience in the conduct of research and a record of peer-reviewed publications and extramural funding are major considerations. Pediatric Cardiac Anesthesiology training/experience is desirable.

 

Academic rank and compensation will be commensurate to qualifications.

 

Please send an electronic letter of intent, curriculum vitae, and three references to:

Hugh C. Hemmings, Jr. M.D., Ph.D.

Chair, Department of Anesthesiology

anes-cardiac@med.cornell.edu

 

EOE/M/F/D/V

Jobs.Description:
Lahey Hospital  Medical Center

Presents

The Twenty-Fourth Annual Symposium

CARDIOVASCULAR DISEASE:  STATE OF THE ART 2013

June 22-25, 2013

Ocean Edge Club and Conference Center

Brewster, Cape Cod, Massachusetts

www.oceanedge.com

Course Directors:    Sherif B. Labib, M.D.  &   David M. Venesy, M.D.

Objectives:  This program is designed to assist physicians and advanced practitioners in caring for patients with both common and complex cardiovascular problems, with an emphasis on practical incorporation of recent advances into practice. 

Topics Covered:  Congestive heart failure, acute and chronic coronary artery disease syndromes, cardiac imaging techniques, atrial fibrillation and other common arrhythmias, new anti-thrombotic agents, valvular heart disease, preventive cardiology, lipids, & hypertension , recent clinical trials and their impact on clinical practice, multiple interactive case panel discussions of common clinical scenarios 

Format:  This 3 ½ day course includes state-of- the-art lectures, panel discussions utilizing illustrative cases, and focused workshops. 

Who Should Attend?   The course is intended for cardiologists as well primary care providers seeking a comprehensive update in cardiovascular diagnostic and therapeutic strategies.

INFORMATION:   www.Lahey.org/CardiologyConference2013

This activity has been approved for AMA PRA Category 1 CreditTM. 

Lahey Clinic, CME Office, 41 Mall Road, Burlington, MA 01805. Telephone: (781) 744-8969.  Facsimile: (781) 744-2930.

Jobs.Description:
The University of Texas

Health Science Center at Houston

Title:   Clinical Research Sonographer

JOB SUMMARY:  The Clinical/Research sonographer is responsible for assisting and supervising cardiac and vascular ultrasound sonographers, participating in research studies in various capacities, and helping the medical and technical staff.

This includes teaching, performing quality assurance functions, maintaining IAC accreditation, promoting good patient care, maintaining protocol adherence, filling in for staff shortages, and performing multiple research study functions.

REQUIREMENTS/RESPONSIBILITIES:

  1. Supervise and mentor cardiac and vascular sonographers, including the setting of goals and implementing cross-training wherever necessary.
  2. Rotate through all of the UTP clinics on a monthly basis.
  3. Keep records and fulfill the requirements that are necessary to maintain the UTP IAC lab accreditation in both vascular and cardiac areas.
  4. Demonstrate knowledge of cardiac anatomy, physiology, embryology, pathology and general cardiac function as well as problem solving skills and the use of independent judgement to obtain accurate recordings of the heart and great vessels including measurement of heart structures and blood flow.
  5. Demonstrate knowledge of venous and arterial anatomy, physiology, pathology and general vascular function.  Be able to follow laboratory exam protocol as well as use independent judgment to obtain diagnostic recordings and measurements of the venous and arterial systems.
  6. Experience in performing Stress Echos.
  7. Experience in the imaging of adult congenital heart disease is preferred but not required.
  8. Be able to implement research protocols and perform research related activities as required.
  9. Maintain skills and knowledge by keeping up with current practices and new advances by attending conferences and scientific sessions.
  10. Insure that a safe, neat and sanitary environment is maintained for patients and staff.
  11. Maintain and implement and update the Policy and Procedures guidelines.
  12. Other duties as assigned.

EDUCATION, CERTIFICATION AND EXPERIENCE: 

  1. Bachelor’s degree or higher is preferred.
  2. Registered Adult Cardiac Sonographer (ARDMS or CCI)
  3. Registered Vascular Sonographer (ARDMS or CCI) is preferred.
  4. Registered Pediatric Cardiac Sonographer preferred (ARDMS or CCI) but not required

PERSONAL CHARACTERISTICS AND COMPETENCIES:

  1. Exceptional interpersonal skills, including the ability to establish and maintain effective relationships with patients, physicians, co-workers and visitors.
  2. The ability to use appropriate judgment, independent thinking and creativity when resolving issues, and to lead and motivate fellow employees, promoting cooperation between various other clinical areas.
  3. Ability to balance multiple priorities.
  4. Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
  5. Ability to use personal computers and select software applications.
  6. Basic knowledge of multiple brands of US machines and of the Xcelera reporting system is preferred.

Physical Requirements:

The employee must frequently lift and/or move up to 25 pounds and be able to push a large wheeled ultrasound machine over a short distance. 

Applications should include a letter of interest, a Curriculum Vita, and the names of at least three references sent by email to: Vikki.Grant@uth.tmc.edu

UTHealth is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, or age.  Under Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act and the Americans with Disabilities Act, reasonable disability accommodations will be provided, as needed.  Additionally, UTHealth extends a preference in employment under Chapter 657 of the Texas Government Code to certain wartime veterans as well as widows and orphans of those killed on active duty.

Jobs.CompanyProfileDescription: The John Ochsner Heart and Vascular Institute (JOHVI) is a comprehensive cardiac and peripheral vascular care center consisting of six sections representing a continuum of care unmatched in the Gulf Coast region. Through ongoing research initiatives, physician training programs and clinical trials, JOHVI continues to set the standard for diagnosis and treatment of heart disease. By providing the finest patient care available anywhere, combined with modern and technologically-sophisticated diagnostic and treatment capabilities, we offer a complete and comprehensive approach to the management of cardiovascular disease.
Jobs.Description:
NON-INVASIVE CARDIOLOGIST

The Department of Cardiology within the John Ochsner Heart and Vascular Institute in Baton Rouge, Louisiana is searching for a Non-Interventional Cardiologist to join our multispecialty group practice.

We are looking for an energetic non-interventional or non-invasive cardiologist to join our 5 physician Cardiology group at our Baton Rouge campus. Ochsner has a multispecialty physician group of more than 150 physicians based in Baton Rouge (www.ochsner.org) with a 201-bed hospital, the Ochsner Medical Center of Baton Rouge.

The Ochsner Baton Rouge Cardiology group is part of and supported by the larger system-wide Department of Cardiology that includes 41 Board certified cardiologists practicing at eight locations throughout Southeastern Louisiana. The Baton Rouge cardiology group offers a full-service cardiovascular practice including all phases of state of the art cardiovascular disease management including advanced imaging, percutaneous coronary revascularization and open heart surgery.

Baton Rouge, the state capital, is a vibrant, modern city, located less than an hour west of New Orleans. The Baton Rouge metropolitan area has a population of over 600,000 and is home of both Louisiana State University and Southern University.

Please e-mail CV to: cwhite@ochsner.org

Christopher J. White, M.D.

System Chairman for Cardiovascular Diseases

John Ochsner Heart and Vascular Institute

(504) 842-3717

Jobs.Description:
Chief, Division of Pediatric Cardiology, Department of Pediatrics

The University at Buffalo is recruiting for a Chief of a newly created Division of Pediatric Cardiology. The Chief will establish an academic cardiology program in the Department of Pediatrics and the Women & Children's Hospital of Buffalo. The new Chief will immediately be able to recruit a junior faculty member. It is expected that this faculty complement will increase as clinical and research duties expand. In addition to providing clinical cardiology service, Division members will teach medical students, residents and fellows, as well as perform basic or clinical research. Resources have been committed to enable the candidate to create and maintain a strong pediatric cardiology program. The candidate will have access to the clinical research facilities and bench laboratories in the brand new state-of-the-art Global Vascular Institute. Support exists to establish a pediatric cardiology fellowship program.

MD, board certified in Pediatrics and Pediatric Cardiology. Suitable clinical/administrative experience in development and supervision of active clinical service. Established academic career. Strong record in at least two of the three academic activities (research, teaching, clinical). Rank and salary commensurate with qualifications.

Interested candidates should apply at: www.ubjobs.buffalo.edu/applicants/Central?quickFind=54836

The State University of New York at Buffalo is an equal opportunity, affirmative action employer/recruiter.

Jobs.CompanyProfileDescription: Intermountain Healthcare is a Utah-based nonprofit system of 22 hospitals, 185 clinics, a Medical Group with some 1,000 employed physicians, a health plans division called SelectHealth, and other health services. Intermountain is widely recognized as a leader in transforming healthcare through high quality and sustainable costs.
Jobs.Description:
At Intermountain Healthcare, you can have it all; a great quality of life and a rewarding career!

Intermountain Healthcare is a world-class organization where clinical excellence is not just a goal, but a given. Our patients deserve the best in medicine, our Physicians deserve the best in life, and Intermountain Healthcare delivers.

 

Cardiac Heart Failure Physician

Intermountain Healthcare

Ogden, Utah

 

Join the McKay-Dee Heart Failure Clinic at McKay-Dee Hospital – Rated one of the nation’s Top 100 Hospitals in 2012 by Truven Health Analytics.

 

 

Excellence

McKay-Dee Hospital has one of the lowest 30 day heart failure re-admission rates in the country at 17% compared to 25% national average. McKay-Dee Heart Failure Clinic’s annual re-admission rate is <1%. Opportunities for clinical research are available: McKay Dee Heart Failure Clinic is one of only 75 sites in the world enrolling patients in the pivotal LAPTOP-HF trial.

 

 

Convenience

The Clinic is located in McKay-Dee Hospital. Practice at one clinic and one hospital. No traffic, no drive time to impede your schedule. Also, the CHF clinic and EP clinic are housed together allowing for optimal patient care and follow up.

 

 

Opportunity

Employment with Intermountain Healthcare Medical Group:

  • Guaranteed salary
  • Full benefits including pension and 401K match
  • Relocation provided

 

Quality of Life

Forbes Magazine ranked Ogden #2 on their list of America’s Most Livable Cities in 2010. Only 35 minutes to Salt Lake City and 20 minutes to Snowbasin Ski Resort, a 2002 Olympic Winter Games venue. Multiple recreational and cultural activities are easily accessible. A community of 400,000, Ogden offers affordable real estate and low cost of living.

 

At Intermountain Healthcare, you can have it all; a great quality of life and a rewarding career!

 

For more information, please contact:

Susan Jenkins, Physician Recruiting, Intermountain Healthcare

Phone: 800-888-3134     Fax: 801-442-3388

e-mail: PhysicianRecruit@imail.org

http://physicianjobsintermountain.org.

Jobs.Description:
The Oklahoma City VA Medical Center is seeking a full-time staff physician to be an Interventional Cardiologist. 

QUALIFICATIONS:  Candidates will be considered who are U.S. or naturalized citizens (non-citizens may be appointed when it is not possible to recruit qualified citizens). Candidates must be proficient in spoken and written English, with one year of dedicated interventional training and preferably a second year of peripheral training. In addition, the candidate should have at least 5 years of post-fellowship experience in Interventional Cardiology including peripheral interventions. The applicant must have a current, full, and unrestricted license to practice in a state, territory or commonwealth of the United States or District of Columbia.

POSITION SUMMARY:  The Cardiologist will participate in inpatient and outpatient quality care, teaching, and research related to cardiovascular diseases. Candidate will apply national and VA guidelines to patient screening, surveillance and management of such diseases. In addition to coronary interventions, the candidate must have training and be proficient in peripheral vascular interventions and echocardiography. The candidate will be heavily involved in research activities within the section; therefore a strong research background is required. Candidate will participate in the education and supervision of trainees. A successful candidate must qualify for a faculty appointment at the Assistant/Associate Professor level at the University of Oklahoma Health Sciences Center.

VA MEDICAL CENTER

921 N.E. 13th Street (05)

Oklahoma City, OK  73104

 For more information, please contact:

Nancy McClure, Recruiter

405-456-5777

Or e-mail at Nancy.McClure@va.gov
